entry.title: Game: Legend of Grimrock (Steam, 2012) (6)
entry.content:
Game: Legend of Grimrock (Steam, 2012) (6)20161105
I've decided to stop playing the game. I feel like there aren't
enough interesting choices in the game. I had to decide at the
beginning which kind of character I will want, but every time I
level up it is obvious what I should do any ultimately the
characters won't play that much different. The levels are entirely
linear, which would be fine if there was a fun gameplay challenge
to conquer them. However, I feel like the combat is very rote,
except when it is annoying that I have to re-key spells or that I
can't use keyboard commands to launch attacks. The puzzles are all
vaguely fun, but not unique enough. The ones that are the most
unique have been the most annoyingly trial-and-error like the
platform puzzle on the last floor. I played through half of the
game and I feel like I know myself enough to know that the rest of
the game will not be enjoyable enough. Sad.

Total time: 7:57
  • Video Games
  • Legend of Grimrock
  • Steam
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition (Steam, 2013)
entry.content:
Game: Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition (Steam, 2013)20161104
I played this for about two hours and did a lot of quests. The
game is very cute and I really like the style. I like the concept
of it much more than I like the actual gameplay. I really like
that you are in way more control than in other RPGs, because you
can just say that you want to be in a fight and what you want to
fight. The problem with this, however, is that you can really
'game' it by ensuring that you are fully rested before every fight
and thus remove the meta-game the developers tried to put in. The
game claims that the day makes it more difficult, but I didn't see
any evidence of that.

The root of the problem is that it is clearly designed as a mobile
tablet game. The interface is entirely mouse-focused, and so it is
very inefficient to click an attack button, select the attack,
select the enemy and repeat. The worst part is that all the
enemies on the screen are labeled with numbers, but you can't type
the number for that enemy to be selected. It is pretty
ridiculous.

I found it so infuriating (and physically painful on my hands) to
play this way that I got the rug option (very cute, by the way,
that the game room decor affects the play) that makes the battles
auto-play. This essentially turned the game into a "clicker" where
I just watch numbers go up and then make a few choices about which
upgrade to get next.

The traces of micro-transactions are all over the game, because
the exciting things in the store cost a lot of gold and you really
don't get that much from every battle. Furthermore, a lot of stuff
is all about temporary effects based on time, which is really
gross.

I feel pretty bad buying this game so long ago and never playing
it and now finding out that it is not worth it. Because the
purchase is so far in the past and a sunk-cost, I don't even know
what price I paid for it, so it feels very disposable. Maybe if I
had played closer to release, I would have felt a bigger
compulsion to complete it, but I don't think I would have actually
enjoyed that. I suppose I just would have had the ability to
return it.

Total time: 2:12
  • Video Games
  • Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition
  • Steam
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Duelyst (Steam, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: Duelyst (Steam, 2016)20161102
I really love the art style of this game---both the pixelated art
in the game and the animation style. It is tactically challenging
and interesting too. I thought I was going to totally win my first
match against a person but was dumb and didn't realize I was
losing. It was very neat to play! I wonder how much I will enjoy
playing by myself though and if I will be aggravated by people
that buy awesome cards.

Total time: 0:41
  • Video Games
  • Duelyst
  • Steam
  • 2016

I played today for about two hours. The game is still quite
fun. It is interesting how long it takes to just do two floors of
the dungeon. You have to do everything so meticulously.

entry.title: Game: Legend of Grimrock (Steam, 2012)
entry.content:
Game: Legend of Grimrock (Steam, 2012)20161027
I started a game today and had a blast playing. I have a Human
Fighter, Minotaur Fighter, Human Rogue, and Human Mage. I got to
the third level and explored a lot. I have been doing the practice
of fully exploring the level, then looking at a guide to see what
I missed. It's pretty cool. I feel like I don't need the turning
buttons and would rather that the strafe buttons just do turning,
but I understand why it is there.

Total time: 3:25
  • Video Games
  • Legend of Grimrock
  • Steam
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - The Delve (iOS, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - The Delve (iOS, 2016)20161026
I played the first map of my first round of The Delve that I
played. It was fun, but a little bit easy. I used Syndrael,
Ashrian, Widow Tarha, and Tomble Burrowell. I got some good
bonuses from the Search tokens and defeated everything before
continuing. The set up and tear down time was a bit painful.

Total time: 1:16

entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (3)20161023
I played for about two hours on one of the side quests after
spending XP. I separated my heroes and got totally creamed. I
should have kept them together and not opened so many doors so
quickly. I definitely learned a lot but will start over the next
time I play. I also sorted all the tiles to make them easier to
find in the future.

Total time: 3:39
  • Video Games
  • Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins
  • iOS
  • 2015

entry.title: Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016) (2)20161023
I finished it. It was very interesting. Very little world-building,
which made it not as good as the normal books. In fact, that's why
the alternate reality was the most interesting part. Nevertheless,
it was very fun. I think it would make an excellent movie,
especially with all of the action.
  • Books
  • 2016

entry.title: Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016)
entry.content:
Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016)20161022
I started reading this today and was very impressed with how
quickly I was wrapped up in the story. I really like the idea of
Albus being a nobody and having compassion for Scorpius. It's a
great premise.
  • Books
  • 2016

entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (2)20161021
The kids picked characters and we went through the tutorial. I'm
surprised at how long it took. I dislike how long it takes to get
the board ready and clean it up. In particular, I'd like to be
able to leave everything out and come back to it, but I think that
doing so would be really unwise because of all the nefarious
things my kids could do. The tutorial seemed to trying to go easy,
but it was actually quite hard.

Total time: 1:44
  • Video Games
  • Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins
  • iOS
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Ghostbusters, starring Melissa McCarthy (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Ghostbusters, starring Melissa McCarthy (2016)20161021
This was very funny. I enjoyed a lot of the gags and the references
to other things. I really enjoyed Kevin's role in the movie. I
thought there was a surprising amount of weird over-acting that
seemed to be done for laughs, but was out of place.
  • Movies
  • 2016
